casebody.data:
Perry L. CRAWFORD, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Samuel DAWKINS, Medical Doctor, Defendant—Appellee. No. 07-6359. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: July 9, 2007. Decided: July 31, 2007. Perry L. Crawford, Appellant Pro Se. Elizabeth P. McCullough, Young, Moore & Henderson, PA, Raleigh, North Carolina, for Appellee. Before MOTZ, KING, and SHEDD, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

*103PER CURIAM:

Perry L. Crawford appeals the magistrate judge’s order * denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the magistrate judge. Crawford v. Dawkins, No. 1:05-cv913 (M.D.N.C. Feb. 26, 2007). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.

The parties consented to the jurisdiction of the magistrate judge pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 636(c) (2000).
